author: Emma Powell
title: CeeLo Green's bizarre golden Grammys look compared to Ferrero Rocher and Quidditch snitch
text:
CeeLo Green‚Äôs bizarre golden Grammys look compared to Ferrero Rocher and Quidditch snitch 
The singer went all out to debut his alter ego, Gnarly Davidson Monday 13 February 2017 08:53 GMT Click to follow Going for gold: Gnarly Davidson (aka CeeLo Green) Christopher Polk/Getty 
CeeLo Green ‚Äôs bizarre golden Grammys look compared to Ferrero Rocher and Quidditch snitch 
CeeLo Green proved quite literally to be Twitter gold after he rocked up to the Grammys dressed head-to-toe in gold. 
The singer ‚Äì real name Thomas DeCarlo Callaway ‚Äì became an intstant meme as he showed off his bizarre outfit, which featured a superhero-like face mask and metallic gloves. 
Green arrived at Los Angeles' Staples Centre on a motorcycle with a group bikers. Bizarre: CeeLo Green debuted his alter ego Gnarly Davidson (Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP) 
Twitter had a field day with the outfit and renamed the singer CeeLo Gold before comparing him to an angry Ferrero Rocher, the golden Quidditch snitch, and C-3PO. 
One user hailed him as a ‚Äúnational treasure‚Äù while another referred to him as a ‚Äúgold goblin‚Äù. Why is CeeLo Green dressed like a Ferrero Rocher üòÇüíÄ #GRAMMYs pic.twitter.com/Cx63rr77Qg ‚Äî Power Rangers NOW (@PowerRangersNOW) February 13, 2017 Who wore the gold better?! #ceelogreen or thimble?! #GRAMMYs pic.twitter.com/iIQJ8hUnd7 ‚Äî Maurie Sherman (@DamnitMaurie) February 13, 2017 why does ceelo green look like ramses from nacho libre pic.twitter.com/6v1Rn9r9Mu ‚Äî „Ö§ (@drewandyandrew) February 13, 2017 
The unusual look was in aid of his new alter ego, Gnarly Davidson. 
He revealed his latest incarnation last week with a stab at CeeLo Green: ‚ÄúLook at me‚Ä¶ LOOK AT ME! YOU DID THIS TO ME CEELO GREEN, YOU F IDIOT. BUT I LIKE IT, I‚Äôm actually‚Ä¶BETTER! Than you‚Ä¶ than everyone! 
‚ÄúA karmikaze upon you! Vengeance is mine sayeth GNARLY DAVIDSON. P.S. TECHNOLOJESUS saves.‚Äù   
The artist wasn't the only famous face hitting the headlines at Sunday night's ceremony.
